title: 110_s1796
content: The conveyance of the Presque Isle Light Station Fresnel Lens to Presque Isle Township, Michigan is detailed in Section 1. The Commandant of the Coast Guard may transfer possession of the Historic Fresnel Lens to Presque Isle Township, Michigan for installation in the Lighthouse as a private aid to navigation. The Commandant of the Coast Guard may transfer possession of the Historic Fresnel Lens to Presque Isle Township, Michigan for installation in the Lighthouse as a private aid to navigation. Upon certification by the Commandant, the Township will receive all rights to the Lens and Federal aids to navigation at the Lighthouse will cease to be operated by the United States. If the Township fails to comply, the Lens may revert back to the United States. If the Township does not comply with the conditions, they must return the Lens to the Commandant at no cost. However, there is an exception for historical preservation where the Township can keep the Lens with approval from the Commandant for installation as an artifact in or near the Lighthouse. The Lens must be preserved as specified by the Commandant. The Lens must be returned to the Coast Guard if not installed by the Township within two years of transfer. The Commandant can transfer additional personal property related to the Lens to the Township. The Commandant may convey the Lens and personal property to the Township without consideration. If the Lens is returned to the Coast Guard, the Township must return all personal property transferred, unless approved by the Commandant. The Commandant will deliver the conveyed property. The Commandant shall deliver property conveyed under this section at the place and in the condition on the date of conveyance, without cost to the United States. The Township must operate the Lens as a Class I private aid to navigation and hold the United States harmless for any claims related to the conveyed personal property. (g) Limitation on Future Conveyance: Any further conveyance of property under this section must have advance approval from the Commandant. If an interest in the property is conveyed without approval, all rights revert to the United States, and the recipient must reimburse the United States for costs incurred in recovering the property. (h) Additional Terms and Conditions: The Commandant may impose additional terms and conditions. The Commandant may require additional terms and conditions to protect the interests of the United States in connection with authorized conveyances.
